thread_structure: "Why don't your cookies last as long as [big brand]?" We get this question weekly. Time for the honest answer. ð§µ
1/ Shelf life = preservatives. The longer it lasts, the more chemicals. That's just science.
2/ Our cookies: 5-7 day shelf life. Their cookies: 6-12 months. Ours have 6 ingredients. Theirs have 23.
3/ Those extra 17 ingredients? Preservatives, emulsifiers, artificial flavors. All FDA-approved, but all unnecessary for taste.
4/ The trade-off: You get butter that actually tastes like butter. Chocolate that melts. Texture that's worth it.
5/ Storage tip: Freeze them. Our cookies freeze beautifully for 3 months. Thaw for 30 minutes = fresh-baked taste.
You're not buying shelf stability. You're buying actual food. That's the difference.

1/ Failed batch count: 47. Yes, forty-seven attempts before we got it right.
2/ The problem: Gluten-free flours don't bind like wheat. You need the right blend + the right hydration + the right baking temp.
3/ Our breakthrough: Combining almond flour, tapioca starch, and psyllium husk. Sounds weird. Tastes incredible.
4/ Texture testing: We had 200+ people blind taste-test against leading brands. Ours won 73% of the time.
5/ Cost reality: These crackers cost us 2.3x more to produce. We're charging 1.8x. We're taking the margin hit.
6/ Why? Because people with celiac disease deserve crackers that don't suck. Full stop.
Launch date: Next month. We're nervous and excited. Mostly excited.
